summary: The Cruise Passenger Protection Act of 2025 aims to enhance passenger vessel safety and security. It establishes an Office of Maritime Consumer Protection within the Department of Transportation, focusing on consumer service improvements, complaint resolution, and the invalidation of certain contract clauses. The bill mandates crime reporting guidelines, video surveillance enhancements, and improved medical standards on cruise ships. It also creates an advisory committee and includes provisions for victim support services and information sharing between agencies.
